column15: Cirsium pallidum is a synonym of Cirsium parryi. Cirsium parryi is a biennial plant growing from a taproot; it produces a basal cluster of leaves and an erect flowering stem that can be 50 - 200cm or more tall[270 ]. The plant is harvested from the wild for local use as a food, medicine and source of materials. It is native to Arizona, Colorado, and New Mexico.
column16: Cirsium pallidum is a BIENNIAL growing to 1.5 m (5ft) by 0.5 m (1ft 8in). The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Bees, flies, Lepidoptera (Moths & Butterflies), beetles. The plant is self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers  moist soil.
